intro: Cynometra floretii, commonly known as the African ironwood tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for construction and furniture. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ecological and economic importance, it is also a species of conservation concern.
